You are given a tree with $n$ vertices. Each edge in the tree has a unique integer value.  

For each pair of vertices $v$ and $u$ in the tree where $v < u$, calculate the number of edge values that appear exactly once along the path between $v$ and $u$. 

Finally, sum up these values for all pairs of vertices $v$ and $u$ where $1 \le v < u \le n$.
